assessment.title: Directions of the Nervous System Structures

p.em: What term(s) could be used to communicate the location of the brain?

response.feedback: This is not the best answer. It is true that the brain is in the head, so it is at the cephalic end of the body. Look again, though: another directional term also means "towards the head."
This is not the best answer. It is true that the superior direction is towards the head, where the brain is located, but another term also indicates the direction towards, near, or in the head.
Incorrect. The inferior direction is towards the feet.
Incorrect. The caudal direction is downward towards the feet or rear of the body.
Correct. The brain is in the head, so it is at the cephalic end of the body, and this is also in the superior part of the body.
Incorrect. Both the inferior and caudal directions are downward and away from the head.
